required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anesthetic Efficacy of X-tip Intraosseous Injection
clinical_study.official_title: Anesthetic Efficacy of X-tip Intraosseous Injection Following Mandibular Nerve Block in Molars With Acute Irreversible Pulpitis

brief_summary.textblock:
- Hypothesis:
- X-tip intraosseous is an effective supplementary injection in mandibular hot teeth as well as Periodontal Ligament (PDL) injection
- Purposes:
- Comparing the anesthetic efficacy of X-tip intraosseous and PDL injection in mandibular hot teeth which had not been anesthetized after 3.6 ml Infra Alveolar Nerve Block
- Methods and Materials:
- forty patients with mandibular hot molar or second premolar which had not been anesthetized after 3.6 ml inferior alveolar nerve block injection will be selected for this study

detailed_description.textblock:
- Randomization:
- All patients will be randomly divided into two groups as follows:
1. X-tip intraosseous injection will be used as supplementary
2. PDL injection will be used as supplementary
- Anesthetic evaluation:
- For anesthetic evaluation we will use Visual Analog Scale (VAS)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participant who will have the pain following X-tip or PDL as a supplementary injection
primary_outcome.description: All particiapant will be asked to show their pain degree on VAS for evaluation the efficacy of injections as a supplementary for anesthetising the teeth before and after the supplementary injection.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before block injection and after supplementary injection
secondary_outcome.description: This record will be monitored by puls oximeter device

intervention.description: Patients will be selected from a group who were not anesthetized following 3.6 ml block injection. Half of the randomly selected patients will receive X-tip intraosseous injection and half will receive PDL injection as a supplementary for completing the anesthesia in selected hot mandibular molar teeth.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mandibular Molars and second premolars with Acute Irreversible Pulpitis
- None of the teeth selected should have been anesthetized following 3.6 ml Lidocaine block injection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unhealthy patients
- Teeth which were anesthetized following 3.6 ml nerve block injection
- Patients who did not have any signs of lip anesthesia following 3.6 ml injection

overall_official.affiliation: Dental Research Center,Faculty of Dentistry, Mashhad University of Medical Sciences, Iran

responsible_party.organization: Faculty of pharmacy, Mashhad University of Medical Sciences
